Message.Title: Icahn's a god!
Message.Msg: He hates corrupt boards of directors. His offer is vastly superior.

No, he is not. He pulled a similar scheme with Blockbuster and destroyed the business. This call for nearly 20 billion in debt. Even if he and a few others take stock instead of money, he still would need about 15 billion. Right after it happens, the price of the stock will go way down. Any smart investor would take the money, and right after sell his stock.

Topic.Title: Icahn offering $12 cash PLUS YOU GET TO KEEP YOUR DELL STOCK !!!

Message.Msg: Icahn will destroy this company. Any smart investor would take the twelve dollars, then turn around and sell the stock. To do this, Icahn would have to borrow about 15 billion dollars, assuming around 75% money redemption. He bought his stock cheaper, so he will walk away with hundreds of millions if not more than a billion. Then he will pay himself and staff handsomely while he is in charge, then dump the holdings, and blame the board for not doing the right thing. Just check out Blockbuster. This is similar to what he did there.

Wait a minute. He's offering $12 cash plus the stock. Say the stock goes falls to $2- you still come out ahead on his deal over the other offer. Icahn is right. No more sweetheart deals from corrupt boards to their friends.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell can offer $15.50 and make Icahn drama go away

Message.Msg: Except that Icahn lets you keep your shares! That's a huge deal for shareholders. Wake up!

Topic.Title: Makin' a deal with the Devil...

Message.Msg: This is similar to the Blockbuster deal. About 75% of the stockholders will take the money, which means the company would have to borrow around 15 billion dollars. The company will not survive that. Even if he doesn't take the cash, which he will little by little, he will have the company pay him and his cronies a lot of money for "services rendered." The when the company is ready to go bankrupt, he will quit with feign disgust, and claim that others are responsible for the demise of the business. Too bad that Dell is also a creep.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell can offer $15.50 and make Icahn drama go away

Message.Msg: Wait a minute, bashford. If the stock was such a great deal at $9, why is the $13.65 so great? Hint: it's not. Icahn lets you keep your shares AND pays you $12. Wake up.

Topic.Title: dell not able fund buy out back to 9

Message.Msg: when there's an offer of 12 in cash on the table, why would it go to 9? are you just trolling?

Topic.Title: Michael Dell can offer $15.50 and make Icahn drama go away

Message.Msg: $13.65 is greater than $9. Those who bought at $9 and sold at $13.65 have made a better than 40% positive return on their investment. Hope this helps.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell can offer $15.50 and make Icahn drama go away

Message.Msg: it is true! but keep $12 and 1 dell share for $1.65 is even superior!

Icahn expect 20% of old shares will convert their $12 cash into new share at $1.65. So after conversion, new dell will have .8+.2*(1+$12/$1.65)=2.45 times number of old shares. Old share earns $1.35/yr; new share will earn $1.35/2.45=$.55/yr. At PE of 3, it would be worth $1.65/share. Therefore, I would go along with Icahn's dell.
The business is decreasing. You cannot apply a multiple to a falling business with any certainty.
